text: When water is dropped on calcium carbide, the gaseous product is an
subject: CHEMISTRY

explanation.text:
Explanation
Mg\(_2\) + 2HCI\(_{(aq)}\) → MgCI\(_{2(g)}\) + H\(_{2(g)}\).
24g Mg reacts with 2g H
1g Mg = \(\frac{2}{24}\)g H
12g Mg = \(\frac{2}{24} \times 12\)g H
= 1g H.
